data.title: If you are from here you go here!!
data.text: Best pizza in town and beyond in my opinion and I'm picky. Free bread and huge pasta portions. These guys do everything right. Love the new building.

data.title: Very Good Italian
data.text: We love Valentino's and go there often. The new place is bigger and the parking is definitely better! But it is alsobusier now. The pizza, spaghetti, and chicken pasta dishes are our favorites.

data.title: New Building
data.text: The New Building caught my eye so I thought I would give it a try.  I discovered this was a new location for an old restaurant that seems to have a lot of regular customers.  I had the penne con broccoli with chicken and a house salad.  While the Penne con broccoli tasted OK, the sauce was thinner and runnier than I prefer.  I have had better in the Rowlett, Texas area and will probably not return to Valentino's.  The service was very good, and the restaurant was clean and the building was brand new.  Parking was adequate and seating was provided indoors and outdoors for those waiting for a table.  Alcoholic beverages are available and the decor is tasteful.

data.title: Top Notch Food!
data.text: Everything at this restaurant is very good!! The waitstaff is attentive and the price reasonable. Love the bread pudding!

data.title: My favorite local Italian!
data.text: This has long been one of my favorites.  When my non-Rowlett friends visit, I always want to take them here.  Customer service is amazing, and the brothers/sister are always around.  I've had the pizza, ravioli, non-carb meals and never been disappointed.  The knot rolls are the best around.  Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: new location same great food and service
data.text: great new location very nice, food was excellent again and the service was friendly and helpful. great pizza salads and pasta

data.title: Great Lunch for 2 at a reasonable price!
data.text: I asked two Rowlett locals for a good place to eat lunch that was not a chain restaurant. They both recommended Valentino's and were so excited about it, that my wife and I immediately went there last Saturday. My wife ordered the hot sub with chips and a dinner salad.  I had the lasagna with a half Caesar salad.  Hot and fresh Garlic bread was brought out several times (no additional charge).  We ate everything, felt full and would order it again. We had several refills on Diet Coke. The service was very good and all the employees were helping each other. Only $24 not counting tip. Very pleased with this place and we will go back.

data.title: Good Food
data.text:
They have good food- hands down.

I really like their new location. However if I had any complaint, it would be about the unorganization of the wait staff. 

Maybe once they get settled into their new location they will figure it out.

data.title: Viva Italia!
data.text: Wonderful Italian family restaurant. large portions of homemade style dishes. And don't for get the hot bread! but don't fill up on it. If you like Italian food you will love this place. It is usually packed so grab a glass of wine and wait. Cheers.

data.title: Can't go wrong.
data.text: Pizza and rolls are delicious. Many pasta dishes that never disappoint and the antipasto salad is terrific.

data.title: Delicious Food
data.text: We have been patrons of Valentino's Restaurant for a few years now. From the very first visit, they made us feel quite welcomed. It's a family run restaurant....they provide excellent service, excellent food and excellent prices. There is wide variety of food to choose from, whether it's their basic dishes like pizza, lasagna, and spaghetti...or specialty dishes that include shrimp, chicken or veal. For anyone that likes Italian food, there is definitely something for everyone.

data.title: One of our favs!
data.text:
Valentino ' s is the BEST! Family owned and operated, the staff is always friendly and the food is great. If you get a salad make sure you try the house tomato-based dressing. What I don't use on my salad I dip my bread in.
If you are into fish, order the stuffed trout! It is AWESOME! And if you like deviate from the menu they are always happy to oblige.
Don't miss out, but go early or be prepared to wait a bit because there is frequently a line out the door.

data.title: Best Italian in Rowlett!
data.text: By far one of the best places to eat in Rowlett. Current location is small and a bit crowded, but they are opening up a much larger location shortly. The staff is always the same (pretty sure the majority are family) and they are the nicest people! They always remember you if you are a frequent visitor! The food is AMAZING! Super larger portions for a super reasonable price! You will always need a to-go box here! If you ever want a take out pizza that is made by a true Italian, this is the place to go! Can't be beat!

data.title: Awesome Italian Food
data.text: Family owned. Great authentic Italian food..awesome service and reasonably priced..TRY the hot olive oil abd garlic dip yum..so maby good dishes you cannot go wrong.

data.title: Best Italian restaurant
data.text: I do not hesitate in saying that Valentinos is by far one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever eaten at. We are frequent customers. Nothing beats their lobster ravioli.

data.title: Real Italian food
data.text:
the staff is like a family,to all of its customers. Its a family all working together to give the best tasty,large portions of authentic 
home made Italian recepies.

data.title: Good food
data.text: The food was very good.  We had pasta and pizza and both were good.  It seems very good for families as well as couples.

data.title: decent food
data.text: Nice place, the food is hit and miss. Had one good meal there with great service then had one not so good meal with so-so service.

data.title: Neighborhood Favorite Italian Restaurant
data.text:
We live in the next town but we always come here for good food and warm hospitality. We have known Val for a long time, coming here is like being invited to an old friend's house for dinner.
Val cooks delicious food and you can ask for items off the menu, he is creative and good nature. You can also request different levels of spiciness.
My favorite meals are fried calamari, eggplant rolls with ham (melanzana supreme?), chicken piccata.

data.title: YUMMY ....LOVE THIS FOOD!!!!!
data.text: This neighborhood restaurant that sits at the end of a strip center is usually very busy because the food is really good!! Actually, It is the best Italian that I have had in Dallas....hands down. It is family run and the recipes are just wonderful...we love  Michaels special...not on the menu but excellent! So many good choices and the warm rolls are not to be missed.  We usually share a meal and get an extra salad because the portions are so large. The service is fast and friendly. I gave it 4 stars because the atmosphere is very average...not fine dining by a long shot but the food is consistently good! Worth a visit!!!
